meanings.definition: A person or thing that is stale.
meanings.sent1: The bread left on the counter for too long became a staler.
meanings.sent2: The staler crackers were not as crunchy as the fresh ones.
meanings.sent3: The staler cookie tried to join the fresh pastries in the bakery.
meanings.sent4: The staler air in the room made it feel musty and old.
meanings.sent5: The staler smell of the room lingered long after the party ended.

meanings.sent1: Leaving the bread out will staler it quickly.
meanings.sent2: The cookies stalered after being forgotten in the jar.
meanings.sent3: The joke started to staler as it was repeated too many times.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to staler as she waited for the bus in the rain.
meanings.sent5: The excitement of the game began to staler as the score gap widened.
